lines.text: Your Majesty, I beg you. They're all waiting down there. What shall we say to them? What can we say to them?

[emphatically]
Nothing. Paul, your arm. I will speak to them.

[calling everyone to attention by clapping]
Everybody, please.

[the Prince escorting the Dowager Empress down the hallway toward the ballroom full of guests]
Forgive me Marie, but what will you say?
Say? Oh, I will say, 'The play is over. Go home.'
We are most of us lonely, and it is mostly of our own making.
But oh please, if it should not be you, don't ever tell me.
The poor have only one advantage; they know when they are loved for themselves.

[to Petrovin]
Would you recognize the smile of a girl you knew ten years ago?

You're both fools! You're examining her as if she was the real Anastasia. There is no Anastasta! She was shot to death ten years ago by a firing squad. We're not looking for her, gentlemen. We're seeking only a reasonable facsimile.
...and that woman is too too something! Too crazy, too clever, too tricky!
I don't care what she is! The important thing is that she fits!
Lievenbaum, your voluptuous fantasies are disgusting! To a woman of your age, sex should mean nothing but gender!
A village. This is positively a village. I am all of Chekov's three sisters rolled into one!
I like the past. It's sweet and familiar.
